Shipwrecks have inspired songs, paintings, and poetry.

The reality is considerably less romantic.

He points at type collection of heavy timbers marking the ghostly outlines of a ship.
You can barely see the stern but enough to get a sense of the size, because an entire ship in the 200 feet in between right under where we're standing.
The three-masted clipper ship was named for a Native American chief who fought a bloody war with New England settlers.

In 1878, it ran aground in a high tide while being towed through the Golden Gate.
Fortunately, the crew survived.
The King Philip is one of about 200 shipwrecks around the Golden Gate, but this one has a habit of resurfacing now and then, says Stephen Haller.
